rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course version {2986, 3462, P4001.2, P6002, P6003}
Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {PGW1102, PGW5102, PGW5202}
Incompatible with {PGW1104, PGW1105, PGW1109, PGW5104, PGW5105, PGW5109}

description: This unit will examine the management of the person with an acute, chronic or atypical wound. Acute wounds may range from simple lacerations to more complex surgical wounds while chronic wounds are those where healing has been delayed. Chronic wounds may include venous leg ulcers, arterial and mixed arterial-venous ulcers, diabetes-related foot ulcers and pressure injuries while atypical wounds may include inflammatory ulcers and less common aetiologies such as pyoderma gangrenosum and neoplastic ulcerations.
faculty: Faculty of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences
